headline: Japan's JERA in advanced talks to buy $1.7 billion of US shale gas assets, sources say
summary: Japan's top power generator JERA is in advanced talks to buy natural gas production assets in the U.S. for around $1.7 billion, people familiar with the matter said, the latest example of the Asian nation investing in America's energy sector.  JERA emerged as the top bidder for the assets owned by GEP Haynesville II, a joint venture between Blackstone-backed GeoSouthern Energy and pipeline operator Williams Companies, after banks solicited offers in recent weeks, the people said, asking not to be identified because the discussions are private.

content.title: Japan's JERA in advanced talks to buy $1.7 billion of US shale gas assets, sources say

thumbnail.caption: The logo of JERA Co., Inc., the world's biggest LNG buyer, is displayed at the company office in Tokyo
